intro: Ampherephis intermedia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ampherephis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
